title: As a user I want to create a new UEC for an Employee
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=info_and_general_layout
Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/UEC+-+Contract+Header
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/UEC+-+Info
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permissions for creating an Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_steps:
WHEN BOC user navigates to any Employee Profile
OR Club user navigates the the Employee Profile of an Employee Belonging to their org
custom_expected:
THEN there should be a "Create New" button on the Employee Profile
AND "Contracts" should be an option in the top-level dropdown
AND selecting "Contracts" should display a secondary dropdown
AND "Employee Contract" should be an option under the secondary dropdown
AND selecting "Employee Contract" from the Create New should load a new Preliminary Contract in edit mode for the relevant player/employee
AND the standard Employee header (or Player if they are not yet an Employee) should appear at the top of the Contract, as it does for Transactions/Profiles
AND the Info section should be expanded by default, and follow the wireframe and data discovery
AND the remainder of the sections should be visible in the contract, but all should be toggled to "No" and not expandable/removable with the delivery of this story
(NOTE: All action buttons and the status bar are handled in other test cases)

title: As a user I want to edit the Compensation section of a UEC
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permission for edit Employee Contract(UEC)
AND Employee has an existing Employee Contract(UEC)
custom_steps: WHEN BOC or Club clicks on Info tab on the Employee Contract(UEC)
custom_expected:
THEN there is a "Compensation" expandable section that appears below the "Info" section.
AND By default, this section is collapsed.
AND This section cannot be removed.
AND Expanding this section will display one line per non-option year contained in the contract, beginning with the Contract Start Year. 
AND The format and fields should follow the wireframe and data discovery. 
AND The Service Start and End Dates should default to whatever values are entered in the Payment Start and End Date fields. 

Wireframe:
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=compensation

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/UEC+-+Compensation

title: As a user I want to add a Signing Bonus to a UEC
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permissions to create an Employee Contract 
AND user initiates an Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_steps: WHEN editing the Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_expected:
THEN there will be a "Signing Bonus" expandable section that appears below the "Options" section.
AND By default, this section is collapsed.
AND This section has a toggle that allows the user to include this section in the contract or not. By default, this is set to "No". 
AND If the toggle is set to "No", then the section is not expandable.
OR If the toggle is set to "Yes", then the section is expandable. 
AND Setting the toggle to "Yes" will automatically expand the section. 
AND Setting the toggle to "No" will automatically collapse the section. 
AND When the section is expanded, there is a "Language" field available, per the data discovery. 
AND When the section is expanded, the format and fields should follow the wireframe and data discovery. 

Wireframe:
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=signing_bonus

title: As a user I want to add an Incentive Bonus to a UEC
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permissions to create an Employee Contract
AND user initiates an Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_steps: WHEN user is editing Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_expected:
THEN there is an "Incentive Bonuses" expandable section that appears below the "Signing Bonus" section.
AND By default, this section is collapsed.
AND This section has a toggle that allows the user to include this section in the contract or not. 
AND By default, this section is toggled to No.  
AND If the toggle is set to "No", then the section is not expandable.
OR If the toggle is set to "Yes", then the section is expandable. 
AND Setting the toggle to "Yes" will automatically expand the section. 
AND Setting the toggle to "No" will automatically collapse the section. 
AND When the section is expanded, there is a "Language" field available, per the data discovery. 
AND When the section is expanded, there is an "Add Clause" button present. 
AND Clicking "Add Clause" will add an Incentive Bonus clause to the contract. 
AND The format and fields should follow the wireframe and data discovery. 
AND The "Add Clause" button will remain available, and the user can continue to add incentive bonuses clauses to the contract by clicking it. 
AND Once a clause has been added, there is a trash can icon on the clause, that when clicked, removes the relevant clause from the Contract. 
AND The clause number should always start at 1 and count up from there. Ex: IB1 would be the first clause, followed by IB2 and IB3. If IB2 is deleted, then IB3 would become IB2. 

Wireframe:
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=incentive_bonus

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/UEC+-+Incentive+Bonuses

*Not Included in this story:*
  - *Required field and formatting checks*
  - *Pay Schedules*
  - *All post-approval edits*
  - *Duplicating clauses*
  - *Maximums Tables*

title: As a user I want to refresh the UEC to account for changes in the number of years included in a UEC
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permissions to create an Employee Contract
AND user initiates an Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_steps: WHEN user is editing Employee Contract
custom_expected:
THEN there is a "Refresh" button available beneath the years fields. 
AND Clicking this button will update the contract to contain the entered number of years in the Compensation section, as well as in all of the dropdowns for Options, Salary Escalators and Incentive Bonuses. 
AND The screen can reload if necessary - but none of the information entered prior to hitting refresh should be lost UNLESS the user is removing years and information has been entered for one of the affected years. 
AND The screen should remain in edit mode.

Wireframe: 
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=info_and_general_layout

title: As a user I want to add an Options clause to a UEC
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club and BOC user is logged in with permissions to create an Employee Contract
AND user initiates an Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_steps: WHEN user is editing Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_expected:
THEN there is an "Options" expandable section that appears below the "Info" section.
AND By default, this section is collapsed.
AND This section has a toggle that allows the user to include this section in the contract or not. 
AND If the toggle is set to "No", then the section is not expandable.
OR If the toggle is set to "Yes", then the section is expandable. 
AND Setting the toggle to "Yes" will automatically expand the section. 
AND Setting the toggle to "No" will automatically collapse the section. 
AND When the section is expanded, there is a "Language" field available, per the data discovery. 
AND When the section is expanded, if the "Option Years" value in the Info section is set to a number greater than 0 (and the contract has been appropriately refreshed), there is an "Add Clause" button present. 
AND Clicking "Add Clause" will add an Options clause to the contract. 
AND The format and fields should follow the wireframe and data discovery. 
AND The "Add Clause" button will remain available, and the user can continue to add options clauses to the contract by clicking it. 
AND Once a clause has been added, there is a trash can icon on the clause, that when clicked, removes the relevant clause from the Contract. 
AND The clause number should always start at 1 and count up from there. Ex: OP1 would be the first clause, followed by OP2 and OP3. If OP2 is deleted, then OP3 would become OP2. 

Wireframe:
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=options

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/UEC+-+Options

*Not Included in this story:*
  - *Required field and formatting checks*
  - *Pay Schedules*
  - *All post-approval edits*

title: As a user I want to add an Expense Reimbursement Covenant to a UEC
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permission to create an Employee Contract
AND user initiates an Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_steps: WHEN user is editing Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_expected:
THEN there is a "Covenants" expandable section that appears below the "Salary Escalators" section.
AND By default, this section is collapsed.
AND This section does not have a toggle. 
AND When the section is expanded, there are expandable subsections for each available Covenant for the UEC. 
AND There is also a "Comments" entry field beneath all of the available covenants. 
AND The first available Covenant is the Expense Reimbursement Covenant. 
AND By default, this subsection is toggled to No.  
AND If the toggle is set to "No", then the subsection is not expandable.
OR If the toggle is set to "Yes", then the subsection is expandable. 
AND Setting the toggle to "Yes" will automatically expand the section. 
AND Setting the toggle to "No" will automatically collapse the section. 
AND When the subsection is expanded, there is a "Language" field available, per the data discovery. 
AND The format and fields should follow the wireframe and data discovery.  

Wireframe:
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=expense_reimbursement

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/UEC+-+Covenants

*Not Included in this story:*
  - *Required field and formatting checks*
  - *Removing and re-adding covenants via the trash can*
  - *All other covenants*

  - Miscellaneous Text
  - Termination
  - Club Special 1
  - Club Special 2

OR If the toggle is set to "Yes", then the subsection is expandable. 
AND Setting the toggle to "Yes" will automatically expand the section. 
AND Setting the toggle to "No" will automatically collapse the section. 
AND When the subsection is expanded, there is a "Language" field available, per the data discovery. 
AND The format and fields should follow the wireframe and data discovery.

title: As a user I want to be able to edit the attachments of a UEC
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permissions to edit an Employee Contract
AND an employee has an exiting employee contract
AND user has navigated to the Contract tab
AND click on the contract
custom_steps: WHEN user is editing Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_expected:
THEN there is an "Executed Contract" expandable section that appears below the "Comments" section.
AND By default, this section is collapsed.
AND This section cannot be removed.
AND Expanding this section will allow the user to use the "drag and drop" area or the "Browse" button to add files to the contract. 
AND Once a file has been added, it appears in the table per the wireframe. 
AND Comments can be added to individual files. 
AND A label is required for each file attached, but the "Contract" label can only be used once. 
AND Only .pdf's should be accepted as valid files.

title: As a user I want to be able to save a new UEC as Preliminary
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permission to create an Employee Contract
AND user initiates an Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing a UEC in edit mode
custom_expected:
THEN there is a "Save" button available. 
AND Clicking the "Save" button will save the contract as it is currently entered.
AND If the contract has not yet been saved, it is assigned a status of "Preliminary". 
AND The contract should reload in View mode whenever the contract is saved in any state.

title: As a user I want to be able to cancel changes to a UEC
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permissions to create an Employee Contract
AND user initiates an Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing a UEC in Edit mode
custom_expected:
THEN there is a "Cancel" button available. 
AND Clicking the "Cancel" button will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to lose their changes.
AND If the user does not confirm, the blocking message is dismissed and the user is returned to the contract with their changes maintained. 
OR If the user does confirm, then, if the contract has never been saved, the user is returned to the point of entry, and the contract is completely discarded.
OR If the user does confirm, and the contract has been previously saved, if it is in a Preliminary state,  then the UEC reloads in edit mode with no changes stored. 
AND In later states, the UEC will reload in view mode with no changes stored.

title: As a user I want to see what stored language I can choose for a clause
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or LRD user is logged in with permissions to create Employee Contract
AND user is creating a employee contract
AND the user has selected a clause or covenant 
AND the user has stored a language for the selected clause or covenant
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks the Language dropdown
custom_expected:
THEN Only stored languages that are on or after their effective dates, and have not been superseded by another effective date will display as an option. (Ex: a language with an effective date of 4/3/2012 will not display if there is a story with an effective date after 4/3/2012 but before today)
AND Only stored languages that are Approved will display as an option.
AND Only stored languages that belong to either LRD or the signing Org will be displayed in the dropdown.  
AND Only one language type can be selected in each clause.
AND Each clause or covenant in a contract that allows for the use of language displays a dropdown where the user can select which type of language they would like to use for that clause. 
AND The dropdown will contain a "Custom" option along with any stored language options that are able to be used for the specific contract.
AND Only one language type can be selected in each clause.
AND Upon selecting "Custom" as the language for the clause, a WISYWIG editor will appear in the contract form. 
AND Users will be able to use the WISYWIG editor to construct custom language using basic formatting such as italics, bolding, underlining and bullet points.
AND Any formatting that will not be supported in printing should not be an option in the WISYWIG editor. 
AND If the user changes the selection from "Custom" to a stored language, if they re-select "Custom" before navigating away from the page the WISYWIG should display any previously entered data. 
AND Each clause or covenant in a contract that allows for the use of language displays a link that allows the user to navigate quickly to the stored language for that clause or covenant. 
AND When there is a stored language selected as the language for a clause, clicking the "View" link will open a new/tab window to display the stored language loaded. (this story does not include the ability to change the language you are viewing).

title: As a user I want to view the text of my selected stored language
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club and LRD is logged in with permission to create employee contract 
AND is creating an individual employee contract
AND is adding a specific clause to a contract 
AND has selected a stored Club OR BOC entered standard language for the selected clause
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks the "View" button that displays next to the language dropdown
custom_expected:
THEN Each clause or covenant in a contract that allows for the use of language displays a link that allows the user to navigate quickly to the stored language for that clause or covenant. 
AND a new/tab window to display the stored language loaded. (this story does not include the ability to change the language you are viewing).

title: As a user I want to save a contract with custom language
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permissions to create Employee Contract
AND user is creating Employee Contract
AND the contract contains custom language
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks  Save
custom_expected: THEN the contract should be saved and entered custom language as part of the contract.

title: As a user I want to be able to remove a covenant from the UEC screen
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged with permissions to create an Employee Contract
AND user initiates an Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_steps: WHEN user is editing the "Covenants" expandable section
custom_expected:
THEN Each of the Covenants can be removed completely from the UEC screen via the trash can icon associated with each covenant. 
AND Clicking the trash can will remove the covenant from the UEC. 
AND The contract must be saved in order for this change to stick.

title: As a user I want to be able to remove certain sections from the UEC
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged with permissions to create an Employee Contract
AND user initiates an Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_steps: WHEN user editing an Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_expected:
THEN any of the sections that can be toggled yes/no also will have a trash can icon associated with them. 
AND Clicking the trash can will remove the relevant section from the UEC. 
AND The contract must be saved in order for this change to stick.

title: As a user I want to view an employee's preliminary contracts in their Contract History
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged with permissions to view an Employee Contract
AND the user is on the employee's contract tab and the employee has a preliminary contract in the system
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks the preliminary contract year or contract leave in the contract history widget
custom_expected:
THEN Preliminary contracts should display in red text in the Contract History. 
AND This should only display for users that have permission to see the Contract in a preliminary state (Users with the same Org or in the BOC).

title: As a user I want to be able to close an employee contract
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club and BOC user logged in with the permissions to view employee contract 
AND a user is viewing a employee contract in the view mode
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks the close button on the form in grey
custom_expected: THEN user is return to their entry point into the contract.

title: As a user I want to be able to move a UEC to Completed
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged with permissions to create an Employee Contract
AND user initiates an Employee Contract (UEC) 
OR user view the existing Employee Contract in Preliminary status
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Update Status" button
custom_expected:
THEN the system will open a menu with the "Completed" option. 
AND Selecting "Completed" will run a required field and formatting check according to the data discoveries.
AND Once the required field and formatting check has passed, the system will store any edits made and update the Contract's status to "Completed". 
AND A blue notification will display that states that the contract's status has been updated to Completed.

title: As a user I want to print a contract
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged with permissions to view the Employee Contract (UEC)
AND an employee has an exiting employee contract
AND user has navigated to the Contract tab
And click on the contract
custom_steps: When user clicks "Print" button
custom_expected: THEN the system will download a pdf of the printed UEC.

title: As a user I want to see the Create New icon on a professional player profile if I have employee create permissions (Part 2)
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with employee create permissions
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to a Professional Player Profile
custom_expected:
THEN If a user has any of the following permissions, then they should see a Create New icon on a Professional Player Profile: 
  - MJ Contract Admin
  - MN Contract Admin
  - MN Transactions Admin
  - MJ Transactions Admin
  - Employee Transactions Admin
  - Employee Contracts Admin
     - BOC UEC Admin
     - Club Field Personnel UEC Admin
     - Club Scouting UEC Admin
     - Club Executives UEC Admin
     - Club Front Office UEC Admin
  - Investigations Admin
   
BUT If they do not have any of these permissions, then they do not see the create new icon on a professional player profile.
AND If the user has any of the Employee Contracts Admin permissions, they should see Employee Contracts as an option for a professional profile.

  - Employee Transactions Admin

     - Club Field Personnel UEC Admin

  - Investigations Admin
BUT If they do not have any of these permissions, then they do not see the create new icon on a professional player profile.
AND If the user has any of the Employee Contracts Admin permissions, they should see Employee Contracts as an option for a professional profile.

title: As a user I want to see the Create New icon on an employee profile if I have create permissions (Part 2)
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with employee create permissions
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to an employee profile
custom_expected:
THEN If a user has any of the following permissions, then they should see a Create New icon on an Employee Profile: 
  - MJ Contract Admin
  - MN Contract Admin
  - Employee Transactions Admin
 - Employee Contracts Admin
     - BOC UEC Admin
     - Club Field Personnel UEC Admin
     - Club Scouting UEC Admin
     - Club Executives UEC Admin
     - Club Front Office UEC Admin
BUT If they do not have any of these permissions, then they do not see the create new icon on an employee profile.
AND If the user has any of the Employee Contracts Admin permissions, they should see Employee Contracts as an option for a professional profile.

title: As a BOC user I want to receive an Approvals item when a UEC is submit signed
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC approver user is logged in 
AND user has an employee contract with a state lower than Submit Signed
custom_steps: WHEN that employee contract is moved to a Submit Signed state
custom_expected:
THEN an Approvals item is generated for the BOC. See Clipboard #1
AND The Employee's Name is in the "Name" column, and is a hyperlink that takes the user to the Employee's History tab.
AND The Level column is populated with "Employee"
AND The Status column is populated with "Submit Signed"
AND The Type column is populated with "Employee Contract". This is a hyperlink to the submitted contract. 
AND From Org/Club is populated with the Signing Org/Club
AND If comments are populated in the Comments section (Not BOC Notes) then they are visible in the Approvals line item. 
AND Any attachments are visible in the Approvals line item. 
AND There is no checkbox for this line item. 
AND Club users should see the "Pending Approvals" counterpart for this on their Pending Approvals widget.

Clipboard: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/UEC+-+Clipboard

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to move a UEC to Reject Signed
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC approver user is logged in
AND user is viewing a UEC in Edit or View mode in submit Signed state
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks the "Update Status" button
custom_expected:
THEN system will display the option to move the contract to "Reject Signed". 
AND Selecting "Reject Signed" will prompt the user via a modal to enter comments for the reason that the contract is being rejected. Comments are not required. ( see attached example from MNCs - note we are not using the "Reason" field).
OR Clicking "Cancel" on the modal will return the user to the contract with no state change made. AN  Upon entering the comments, and clicking "Reject", the system will perform the below AC, along with adding a "Rejection Reason" field to the "Status & Dates" portion of the UEC that is visible to the Club and BOC.( see attached example from MNCs).
AND The contract is assigned a status of "Reject Signed". 
AND The contract in the player's Contract History should appear in green. 
AND The contract should reload in View mode if it was previously in edit mode. 
AND A blue notification will display that states that the contract's status has been updated to Reject Signed.
AND Moving the contract to Reject Signed will remove any BOC Approvals item that exists for the UEC.


View-Edit-State Change Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/2.+UEC+-+View-Edit-State+Change+Rules

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/UEC+-+Data+Discovery (must click into lower level documents)

Reject Signed Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/6.+Reject+Signed+-+State+Change+Rules

title: As a user I want an assign/reassign transaction associated with a UEC moved to Reject Signed to also be Rejected
custom_preconds:
Clipboard: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/UEC+-+Clipboard
GIVEN a boc or club user is logged in
AND a UEC for an employee has been moved to "Submit Signed"
AND a corresponding Assign/Reassign transaction has been generated for the Employee
custom_steps: WHEN user moves UEC to a Reject Signed state
custom_expected:
THEN system should check if the Assign/Reassign transaction generated by the system on moving the contract to "Submit Signed" is still in a submitted state
AND if no, no further action should be taken
BUT if yes, then the system should move the Assign/Reassign transaction to a rejected state

title: As a Club user I want to receive an action item when a UEC is moved to Reject Signed
custom_preconds:
GIVEN Club user is logged in with UEC permission
AND a BOC user moved an UEC contract to a Reject Signed state
custom_steps: WHEN Signed Club user is viewing the Action Items on the Clipboard
custom_expected:
THEN an Action Item item will be generated for the Signing Org. See Clipboard #5.
AND The Type column is populated with "Employee Contract". 
AND Description should read "Employee Contract moved to Reject Signed - View Contract for Rejection Reason" and should be a hyperlink to the UEC.

Clipboard: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/UEC+-+Clipboard

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to move a UEC to Approved
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC approver logged in with UEC permission
AND user is viewing a UEC in Edit or View mode in submit Signed state
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks the "Update Status" button
custom_expected:
THEN system will display the option to move the contract to "Approved". 
AND Selecting "Approved" will run a required field and formatting check. 
AND Once the required field and formatting check passes, the system saves any changes made to the contract and assigns the contract a status of "Approved". 
AND The contract in the player's Contract History should appear in black. 
AND The contract should reload in View mode if it was previously in edit mode. 
AND A blue notification will display that states that the contract's status has been updated to Approved.
AND Approvals item is removed.

NOTE: Clubs do not see the Update Status button in Submit Signed. 






View-Edit-State Change Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/2.+UEC+-+View-Edit-State+Change+Rules

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/UEC+-+Data+Discovery (must click into lower level documents)

title: As a user I want a contract with a future start year to be set to "Approved for Next Season" if the employee has a current "Approved" contract
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC approver logged in with UEC permission
AND an employee has an existing UEC for current year
custom_steps: WHEN user approves a new contract with a future year start date
custom_expected:
THEN system will set that contract's status to "Approved for Next Season". 
BUT If an employee does not have a current Approved contract, approving a contract with a future year start date will set that contract's status to "Approved".

Approval Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/7.+Approving+a+UEC+Contract

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to move a UEC to Expired
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC Approver logs in with UEC Edit permissions
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing an UEC in Edit or View Mode in Approved state
custom_expected:
THEN there will be an Update Status button. 
AND Clicking the "Update Status" button will display the option to move the contract to "Expired". 
AND Selecting "Expired" will run a required field and formatting check. 
AND Once the required field and formatting check passes, the system saves any changes made to the contract and assigns the contract a status of "Expired". 
AND The contract should reload in View mode if it was previously in edit mode. 
AND A blue notification will display that states that the contract's status has been updated to Expired.
AND A notification is sent to the Signing Org. See Clipboard #7

NOTE: Clubs do not see the Update Status button in Approved. 

View-Edit-State Change Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/2.+UEC+-+View-Edit-State+Change+Rules

Expired Rule changes: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/8.+Expired+-+State+Change+Rules

Clipboard: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/UEC+-+Clipboard

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/UEC+-+Data+Discovery (must click into lower level documents)

title: As a user I want to be able to move a UEC to Preliminary
custom_preconds: GIVEN Club or BOC logs in with UEC Edit permissions
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing an UEC in Edit or View Mode in Completed or Reject Signed
custom_expected:
THEN there will be an Update Status button. 
AND Clicking the "Update Status" button will display the option to move the contract to "Preliminary". 
AND Selecting "Preliminary" will assign the contract a status of "Preliminary". 
AND The contract in the player's Contract History should appear in red. 
AND The contract should reload in View mode if it was previously in edit mode. 
AND A blue notification will display that states that the contract's status has been updated to Preliminary.
AND If the UEC is being moved from Reject Signed to Preliminary, the associated Action Item is removed.

State Diagram: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/UEC+-+State+Flow

View - Edit - State rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/2.+UEC+-+View-Edit-State+Change+Rules

Completed state change rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/4.+Completed+-+State+Change+Rules

Reject Signed state change rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/6.+Reject+Signed+-+State+Change+Rules

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to move a UEC to Terminated
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC Approver logs in with UEC Edit permissions
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing an UEC in Edit or View Mode in Approved state
custom_expected:
THEN there will be an Update Status button. 
AND Clicking the "Update Status" button will display the option to move the contract to "Terminated". 
AND Selecting "Terminated" will run a required field and formatting check. 
AND Once the required field and formatting check passes, the system saves any changes made to the contract and assigns the contract a status of "Terminated". 
AND The contract should reload in View mode if it was previously in edit mode. 
AND A blue notification will display that states that the contract's status has been updated to Terminated.
AND A notification is generated for the Club user.

NOTE: Clubs do not see the Update Status button in Approved. 

View-Edit-State Change Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/2.+UEC+-+View-Edit-State+Change+Rules

Terminated Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/9.+Terminated+-+State+Change+Rules

title: As a user I want to see a status bar at the top of UECs
custom_preconds: GIVEN the CLUB/BOC user logs in with UEC permission
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing an UEC in different statuses
custom_expected:
THEN there will be a Status Bar the top of the contract
AND When the contract status is in preliminary, it will display in red, per the wireframe.
OR When the contract status is Completed, it will display in Green.
OR When the contract status is Submit Signed it will display in Green.
OR When the contract status is in Reject Signed, it will display in Green. 
OR When the contract status is Approved or higher, it will display in black.

Wireframe: 
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=info_and_general_layout

State Flow:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/UEC+-+State+Flow

title: As a user I want to be able to search for Employee Contracts
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user logged in with Employee Contract permissions
AND the user has navigated to Advances Search
custom_steps: WHEN the users selects Employee Contracts for "Search For" field
custom_expected:
THEN The filters available when "Employee Contracts" has been selected will match the provided specs. 
AND Clicking search will search the database for any Employee Contracts that meet the applied filters.
AND After results are found, the results will display according to the requirements.
AND Users will be able to export these results to excel.
AND Users will be able to export these results to pdf. 
AND Users will be able to use the type to filter option
BUT If no results are found the table displays with "No records found"

title: As a user I want to save an employee contract with Club standard language in a clause
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permissions to create Employee Contract
AND user is creating Employee Contract
AND user has selected a clause 
AND user has stored a language for the selected clause
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks the Language dropdown
custom_expected:
THEN If stored Club language is available for the selected clause, then it is displayed in the Language dropdown.
AND The user can select the stored language for use in the clause.
AND Selecting a stored language for use does not prompt the language to appear on the contract itself (on the front-end).
AND Clicking "Save" or updating the contract state should save the selected language so that when the contract is re-opened the language is still selected.

title: As a user I want to save an employee contract with BOC standard language in a clause
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permissions to create Employee Contract
AND user is creating Employee Contract
AND user has selected a clause 
AND user has stored a language for the selected clause
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks the Language dropdown
custom_expected:
THEN If stored BOC/LRD language is available for the selected clause, then it is displayed in the Language dropdown. 
AND The user can select the stored language for use in the clause.
AND Selecting a stored language for use does not prompt the language to appear on the contract itself (front-end).  
AND Clicking "Save" or updating the contract state should save the selected language so that when the contract is re-opened the language is still selected.

See Wireframe:
http://30ac5x.axshare.com/#p=major_league_compensation

title: As a user I want to enter and save Complex language on a bonus clause
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permissions to create Employee Contract
AND user is creating Employee Contract
AND user has selected a Bonus clause 
AND user wants to enter complex language in a Bonus clause
custom_steps: When the user selects "Complex" as the criteria for a bonus clause, salary escalator or conditional option
custom_expected:
Business Value:
Allows clubs and LRD to create their own criteria for awarding an incentive bonus, salary escalator or Option. 

THEN a WISYWIG editor will appear in the contract form.
AND Users will be able to use the WISYWIG editor to construct custom criteria for the bonus using basic formatting such as italics, bolding, underlining and bullet points.
AND Any formatting that will not be supported in printing should not be an option in the WISYWIG editor.
AND Users have requested that the WISYWIG editor used be compatible with copy/paste from MS Word.
AND WISYWIG editor needs to be able to accommodate Spanish language and special characters.
AND Maintain the text entered if "Complex" is selected, even if the user switches to another Criteria as long as they have NOT the contract between switching. 
AND Clicking "Save" or updating the contract state should save the entered language so that when the contract is re-opened "Complex" is still selected and the WISYWIG is populated with the entered text.

title: As a user I want to be able to delete an employee contract
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC logged in with permissions to delete an employee contract
AND a user is in edit or view mode for preliminary or reject signed employee contracts
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on delete button
custom_expected:
THEN Clicking delete should prompt the user to confirm the deletion.
**Title:** Warning
**Body:** Are you sure you want to delete this [form]? ("Form" to be replaced with Employee Contract)
**Hint:** This is a permanent action that cannot be undone.
**Buttons:** Yes, No
AND If they confirm the deletion, the contract should be removed from the system and no longer displayed on the player's Contract History or appear in search results. 
OR If they do not confirm the deletion, no action should be taken and they should be returned to the form. 
AND The user should be returned to the player's Contract History.

title: As a user I want to be able to add a Pay Schedule to a UEC
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club and BOC is logged in with the permission to create employee contract
AND the user is creating employee contract
AND the user wants to add a Payment schedule to the contract they are creating
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on the Pay SCH button
custom_expected:
THEN the system will launch a pop up where the user can view/edit the Pay Schedule
AND If the contract is in edit mode, then the Pay Schedule is in edit mode.
AND If the contract is in view mode, then the Pay Schedule is in view mode. 
AND In edit mode If no payments exist yet, the payment schedule should show a blank row by default (in edit mode only). 
AND If payments do exist, those should display. 
AND The user should see the buttons OK and Cancel. 
AND Clicking OK does NOT save these changes permanently. These changes are only stored in the database when the entire contract is Saved. 
AND Clicking Cancel will discard any changes made to the Payment Schedule, and no rules will fire. The payment schedule will close and no changes will be stored.

title: As a user I want to be able to move a UEC to Submit Signed
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with UEC edit permissions
AND user is viewing a UEC in edit or view mode in Preliminary status
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Update Status" button
custom_expected:
THEN system will display the option to move the contract to "Submit Signed".
AND Selecting "Submit Signed" will perform a required field and formatting check, and if that passes then save the contract as it is currently entered.
AND The contract is assigned a status of "Submit Signed". 
AND The contract in the player's Contract History should appear in green. 
AND The contract should reload in View mode if it was previously in edit mode. 
AND A blue notification will display that states that the contract's status has been updated to Submit Signed.

title: As a user I want to be able to resubmit a UEC
custom_preconds:
View-Edit-State Change Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/2.+UEC+-+View-Edit-State+Change+Rules
Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/UEC+-+Data+Discovery (must click into lower level documents)
Reject Signed Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/6.+Reject+Signed+-+State+Change+Rules
GIVEN a user is logged in as a Club or BOC user with Edit permissions for a UEC
custom_steps: WHEN user opens a UEC in Edit or View Mode in Preliminary
custom_expected:
THEN there should be an Update Status button
AND clicking the "Update Status" button should display the option to move the contract to "Submit Signed"
AND selecting "Submit Signed" should perform a required field and formatting check, and if that passes then save the contract as it is currently entered
AND the contract should be assigned a status of "Submit Signed"
AND the contract in the player's Contract History should appear in green
AND the contract should reload in View mode if it was previously in edit mode
AND a blue notification should display that states that the contract's status has been updated to Submit Signed
AND any "Rejection Reason" comments that were previously visible on the UEC should be removed
AND an Approvals item should be generated for the BOC
AND the Action Item for the UEC should be removed.
AND if the employee's current position does not match that contained in the UEC, then an Assign/Reassign Transaction should be auto-created and submitted by the system for the position contained on the UEC

title: As a user I want any attachment with a label of Contract to be stamped on approval
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user created a Employee contract 
And Attached valid contract PDF
custom_steps: WHEN the Contract is moved from Update Status - > Approved
custom_expected:
THEN system will prompt the user to pick where to place the signature stamp. 
AND "Default" will be the default selection on the pop up. 
AND "Custom" will be the other option. Selecting "Custom" will display fields for the user to specify the page (counted back from the last page) and the x/y coordinates for the signature stamp. The fields will default to the default location as calculated by the system based on the current version of the saved contract. 
AND "None" will be another option. Selecting "None" will not stamp the contract at all when "Approve" is clicked. 
AND The buttons on the pop up will be "Approve" and "Cancel". 
AND Clicking "Cancel" will close the popup and cancel the state change. 
AND If "Custom" is selected, the "Approve" button will be disabled if any of the fields are left blank. Otherwise, clicking Approve will stamp the attached pdf with the signature stamp in the indicated location. 
AND If "Default" is selected, the "Approve" button is always enabled and the system will stamp the attached pdf on Approve in the default location. 
AND The date used is the date the UEC was Approved.

*Note that this matches the process used for MJ Contracts*

title: As a user I want to be able to edit an existing UEC
custom_preconds:
View-Edit-State Change Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/2.+UEC+-+View-Edit-State+Change+Rules
On Save Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/10.++On+Save
**All of these steps assume proper edit permissions and that Club users belong to the Signing Org**
GIVEN a user is logged in with edit permissions for UEC
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to edit an existing UEC
custom_expected:
THEN Club users should be able to edit any portion of the UEC in Preliminary and Reject Signed states
AND Club users should only be able to edit the Authorized Signatory, Signing Date, and Attached Files in a Completed State
AND Club users should not only be able to edit option or salary escalator decisions(if applicable) in the Submit Signed or Approved or higher states
AND BOC users should be able to edit any fields in all of the states
AND saving in any state other than Preliminary and Reject Signed should run all required field and formatting checks
AND saving the contract in any Approved or higher state should run all required field and formatting checks, as well as all On Submit and On Approve rules
AND saving the contract in any Approved or higher state should check that there is not a new "Contract" attachment
AND if there is a new "Contract" attachmen, the user should be given the option to stamp the attached contract
AND the stamp should have the date of the Approval - not the current date

title: As a user I want to see an error if I attempt to create a new UEC for an employee that does not belong to my Org
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC and CLUB users have UEC permission
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects "Employee Contract" from the Create New menu for an employee that does not belong to my Org
custom_expected:
THEN  the system will check to see if the person is currently classified as an employee.
AND If yes, and the employee has a current Org, the system will verify that the Employee belongs to the same Org that the Club user belongs to. 
AND  If the employee does NOT belong to the same Org as the user, then display  error #2.
BUT If the employee is currently unaffiliated, any Org may create a UEC for them.

On Create Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/1.+UEC+-+On+Create+Rules

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/UEC+-+Messages

title: As a user I want to be able to run the Expire UEC batch
custom_preconds: GIVEN CLUB and BOC user  has employee permission
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to "Major Contracts" section on the batch screen
custom_expected:
THEN user should see "UEC Expiration Batch" option 
AND Clicking "UEC Expiration Batch" opens the batch in the batch screen. 
AND The batch parameters display per the batch requirements. 
AND A "Run" button is available. 
AND Clicking "Run" will run the batch according to the selected parameters. 
AND When the batch is run: 
    - Get all approved contracts to be expired (contracts whose latest service end date is in the past.)
    - Iterate over contracts
    - If there are no options - expire the contract
    - If the last year is an option year - expire the contract only if none of the options are exercised.
    - Any employees' whose contracts were expired and have contracts that were in "Approved for Next Season" state are updated to "Approved" state
    - If the employee has an Approved, Approved for Next Season, or Submit Signed UEC for and it is for the same organization as the contract being expired, then if the employees current position is different than the position in the contract not being expired, a reassign to org transaction is generated for the employee and Submitted to BOC.
    - If any of the contracts being moved to an "Approved" state overlap with a current Approved contract, then update the status of the existing Approved contract to "Superseded" 
    - Any employees' whose contracts were expired who do NOT have an Approved, Approved for Next Season, or Submit Signed UEC for the same organization as the contract being expired should have a Remove Employee from Org transaction generated for them and Submitted to BOC.      
AND Results will only include employees who had a contract updated by the batch and should display in the "Batch Results" widget. Available columns should be Errors, Player ID, Name (Last, Roster), Org (current Org), Contract ID, Signing Org (Org contract is with), 
Start Year, Non Option Yrs, Option Yrs, Status (Contract Status)
AND Batch run information should display in the batch history widget.

Batch Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/11.+UEC+Expiration+Batch

title: As a user I want to enter bonus/salary escalator information on an approved UEC
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Club or BOC users have UEC permission
AND An Approved UEC already exists for an Employee
custom_steps: WHEN user opens the UEC in Edit mode
custom_expected:
THEN the user should be able to enter in the earned information for Incentive Bonuses and have that saved, according to the data discovery. 
AND the user should be able to enter in the earned information for Salary Escalators and have that saved, according to the data discovery.

title: Employee Contracts - Viewer Permissions- BOC
custom_preconds: GIVEN a BOC user is logged in with Employee Contracts Viewer Permissions
custom_steps: WHEN BOC user attempts to do anything with an Employee Contract
custom_expected:
THEN BOC user should be able to view and Print all employee contracts in all states 
AND user should be able to view all flags for employee contracts and their attachments in all states
BUT user should not be able to make any changes or e-sign

title: Employee Contracts - Field Personnel Editor permissions
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club user is logged in with Employee Contracts Field Personnel Editor Permissions
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to do anything with an Employee Contract
custom_expected:
THEN Club users with a Field Personnel Editor permission can view and print all employee contracts in all states when the logged in Org matches the "Signing Org" for that employee contract AND the position of the UEC is listed in the Permissions category of "Field Personnel".
AND Club users with this role can edit and make all state changes allowed by Clubs according to the state flow rules for Contracts that have a position listed in the Permissions of "Field Personnel" (subject to any restrictions detailed in the data discovery and rules documents).  
AND It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the contract. It also does not matter which Org the involved employee currently belongs to.
          However, there are exceptions:
                  1. They cannot edit or change these contracts
                  2. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field
AND Club users with this role STILL CANNOT view ANY employee contract for other Clubs (driven by Signing Org of the UEC). The user can see other Orgs' contracts in Contract History, Advanced Search and Player History - but can not open them, and can NOT see any salary information in any of these places.
AND Even if the user has another UEC view permission, if they do not have Field Personnel Viewer or Editor, then the user can see Field Personnel contracts in Contract History, Advanced Search and Player History - but can not open it, and can NOT see any salary information in any of these places.

Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/UEC+-+Permissions

title: Employee Contracts - Executives Editor permissions
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club user is logged in with Employee Contracts Executives Editor Permissions
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to do anything with an Employee Contract
custom_expected:
THEN Club users with an Executives Editor permission can view and print all employee contracts in all states when the logged in Org matches the "Signing Org" for that employee contract AND the position of the UEC is listed in the Permissions category of "Executives".
AND Club users with this role can edit and make all state changes allowed by Clubs according to the state flow rules for Contracts that have a position listed in the Permissions of "Executives" (subject to any restrictions detailed in the data discovery and rules documents).  
AND It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the contract. It also does not matter which Org the involved employee currently belongs to.
          However, there are exceptions:
                  1. They cannot edit or change these contracts
                  2. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field
AND Club users with this role STILL CANNOT view ANY employee contract for other Clubs (driven by Signing Org of the UEC). The user can see other Orgs' contracts in Contract History, Advanced Search and Player History - but can not open them, and can NOT see any salary information in any of these places.
AND Even if the user has another UEC view permission, if they do not have Executives Viewer or Editor, then the user can see Executives contracts in Contract History, Advanced Search and Player History - but can not open it, and can NOT see any salary information in any of these places, even if their Org is the same as the Signing Org.

title: Employee Contracts - Front Office Editor permissions
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club user is logged in with Employee Contracts Front Office Editor Permissions
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to do anything with an Employee Contract
custom_expected:
THE Club users with a Front Office Editor permission can view and print all employee contracts in all states when the logged in Org matches the "Signing Org" for that employee contract AND the position of the UEC is listed in the Permissions category of "Front Office".
AND Club users with this role can edit and make all state changes allowed by Clubs according to the state flow rules for Contracts that have a position listed in the Permissions of "Front Office" (subject to any restrictions detailed in the data discovery and rules documents).  
AND It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the contract. It also does not matter which Org the involved employee currently belongs to.
          However, there are exceptions:
                  1. They cannot edit or change these contracts
                  2. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field
AND Club users with this role STILL CANNOT view ANY employee contract for other Clubs (driven by Signing Org of the UEC). The user can see other Orgs' contracts in Contract History, Advanced Search and Player History - but can not open them, and can NOT see any salary information in any of these places.
AND Even if the user has another UEC view permission, if they do not have Front Office Viewer or Editor, then the user can see Front Office contracts in Contract History, Advanced Search and Player History - but can not open it, and can NOT see any salary information in any of these places, even if their Org is the same as the Signing Org.

title: Employee Contracts - Scouting Editor permissions
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club user is logged in with Employee Contracts Scouting Editor Permissions
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to do anything with an Employee Contract
custom_expected:
THEN Club users with a Scouting Editor permission can view and print all employee contracts in all states when the logged in Org matches the "Signing Org" for that employee contract AND the position of the UEC is listed in the Permissions category of "Scouting".
AND Club users with this role can edit and make all state changes allowed by Clubs according to the state flow rules for Contracts that have a position listed in the Permissions of "Scouting" (subject to any restrictions detailed in the data discovery and rules documents).  
AND It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the contract. It also does not matter which Org the involved employee currently belongs to.
          However, there are exceptions:
                  1. They cannot edit or change these contracts
                  2. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field
AND Club users with this role STILL CANNOT view ANY employee contract for other Clubs (driven by Signing Org of the UEC). The user can see other Orgs' contracts in Contract History, Advanced Search and Player History - but can not open them, and can NOT see any salary information in any of these places.
AND Even if the user has another UEC view permission, if they do not have Scouting Viewer or Editor, then the user can see Scouting contracts in Contract History, Advanced Search and Player History - but can not open it, and can NOT see any salary information in any of these places, even if their Org is the same as the Signing Org.
